headline.main: Too Ill to Learn; Health System Fails to Meet Students' Needs, Educators Say

docs.section_name: Education; Health; New York and Region
docs.lead_paragraph: In a second-grade classroom on the Lower East Side, plaster flakes cascade from an old ceiling when students slam the door. But it is not the threat of airborne asbestos or the sealed, contaminated rooms that worry educators at Public School 15; it is the students who come to school sick every day. Some bring along breathing pumps for their asthma. Some have been exposed to H.I.V. Some can hardly concentrate because of throbbing toothaches; others cannot see the chalkboard.
